author: Jason Douglas
title: Bank of England Holds Steady as May Aims for Brexit Transition Deal
text:
LONDONâ€”The Bank of England signaled that it remains on course to lift interest rates in Britain this year and next, as figures showed a yearlong squeeze on consumers caused by a steep fall in the pound appears to be coming to an end.
The British economy is nevertheless expected to trail its peers in 2018 as uncertainty over Brexit stifles business investment. The government hopes that a deal on a key aspect of withdrawal expected to be formally agreed by European Union leaders in Brussels later Thursday will help get firms...
